title: Designing Tutoring and Scaffolding Architectures for Integrating Collaborative Learning Processes

context.prior_knowledge: Competency in mathematical problem-solving and ability to use basic digital tools
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing collaborative learning environment construction to improve mathematical thinking skills among practicing professionals

learning_goals: Learners can implement IMS LD-based learning designs—explicitly structuring collaborative learning processes—with 80% accuracy.
Learners can independently facilitate mathematical problem-solving activities three or more times by combining tutoring systems with process scaffolding.
Learners can adaptively adjust learning stages by over 90% using control primitives provided in digital collaboration tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
